case_vignette:
A 55-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-day history of decreased urine output, progressively worsening bilateral pedal edema, and fatigue. He has a 4-month history of persistent lower back pain. He has hypercholesterolemia and stable angina pectoris. Current medications include atorvastatin, aspirin, and ibuprofen. His pulse is 80/min, respirations are 16/min, and blood pressure is 150/100 mm Hg. Examination shows periorbital and pedal edema and pallor. There is tenderness of the lumbar spinal vertebrae. Straight leg raise test is negative. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 8.9 mg/dl
Serum
Urea nitrogen 20 mg/dl
Creatinine 2.4 mg/dl
Calcium 11.2 mg/dl
Alkaline phosphatase 140 U/L
X-ray of the spine shows diffuse osteopenia and multiple lytic lesions.
question: Which  is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have been experiencing decreased urine output, worsening swelling in both of my feet, and feeling very tired. Also, I have persistent lower back pain.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing decreased urine output, swelling in my feet, and fatigue for the past 3 days, and the lower back pain has been persistent for 4 months.
Do you have any known history of kidney problems or any other chronic diseases?
I have hypercholesterolemia and stable angina pectoris, but no known kidney problems previously mentioned.
Have you been on any new medications recently or experienced any other changes in health or lifestyle?
I am currently on atorvastatin, aspirin, and ibuprofen for my existing conditions, but no new medications have been mentioned.
Have you noticed any change in the color of your urine or experienced any pain or burning sensation while urinating?
No, I have not noticed any change in the color of my urine or experienced any pain or burning sensation while urinating.
Do you have a family history of kidney disease or other related illnesses?
I haven't mentioned any family history of kidney disease or other related illnesses.
Final Diagnosis: Acute kidney injury (AKI)
